definitions.definition: A complete assembly , consisting of an artillery tube and a breech mechanism, firing mechanism or base cap , which is a component of a gun , howitzer or mortar , which may include muzzle appendages .
Any similar device for shooting material out of a tube.
examples: water cannon ; glitter cannon ; confetti cannon ; potato cannon

definitions.definition: A bone of a horse ’s leg , between the fetlock joint and the knee or hock .
( cooking ) A rolled and filleted loin of meat .
examples: a canon of beef or lamb

definitions.definition: ( historical ) A large muzzle-loading artillery piece.
( sports , billiards , snooker , pool ) A carom .
examples: In English billiards, a cannon is when one’s cue ball strikes the other player’s cue ball and the red ball on the same shot; and it is worth two points.

definitions.definition: ( baseball , figuratively , informal ) The arm of a player who can throw well .
examples: He’s got a cannon out in right.

definitions.definition: ( engineering ) A hollow cylindrical piece carried by a revolving shaft , on which it may, however, revolve independently.

( historical ) A cylindrical item of plate armor protecting the arm, particularly one of a pair of such cylinders worn with a couter , the upper cannon protecting the upper arm and the lower cannon protecting the forearm.
( printing , uncountable ) Alternative form of canon ( “ a large size of type ” ) .
( xiangqi ) A piece which moves horizontally and vertically like a rook but captures another piece by jumping over a different piece in the line of attack.
